clinical_study.brief_title: Dancing Against Fall Fractures in Osteoporosis Patients and Healthy Elderly
clinical_study.official_title: Dancing as Training Method for Fall Preventing in Patients Suffering From Osteoporosis

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates physiological measurements and their role in among falls in healthy elderly (65yr or older) or elderly suffering from osteoporosis. The study further seeks to evaluate if dancing can be used as training for preventing falls.

detailed_description.textblock: This study seeks to examine the relationship between strength, postural control and bone mineral density on the risk of falling among elderly (65 yr or older). The study will carried out on osteoporosis patients and healthy, matched controls. The study further seeks to examine whether a dancing intervention may improve any of these parameters, resulting in a decreased risk of falling.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 6- and 18 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 6- and 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: Postural sway measured using a high resolution three-dimensional force platform

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain intensity rating: McGill Pain Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 6- and 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: Pain on an 11-point numerical rating scale (0 = no pain, 10 = most intense pain imaginable), indicating pain areas on a body chart and filling out a McGill Pain Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 6- and 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of physical activity using the Physical Activity Scale for Elderly (PASE) questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 6- and 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of fitness using the Fullerton Functional Fitness Assessment. The test is a 6-item test. The score in each of the six tests is assessed separately and will not be used to provide a total score of the six tests.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 6- and 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the dynamical balance using the Mini-Balance Evaluation Systems Test (Mini-BESTest), which is a 14-item test, scored on a 3-level ordinal scale. The scale ranges from 0-28, with a higher score representing better dynamical balance.
Bone mineral density (g/cm2) measured at spine (L1-L4) and hip, using a Hologic DXA scanner.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 6- and 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: Kinematic analysis of gait, recorded using the Xsens system

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 6- and 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: A n-back test is performed. Total number of substractions and number of mistakes made are evaluated.

arm_group.description: Dance intervention group, inspired by the rhythm of Salsa. Training will be administered for an hour twice a week, for six months.
Strength training group. Training will be administered for an hour twice a week, for six months.

intervention.description: One hour of training, twice a week, for six months.

criteria.textblock:
Patient groups
Inclusion Criteria:
- Verified osteoporosis (T-score -2.5 to -3.5) from previous Dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry scanning (DXA)
- Receiving medical treatment for osteoporosis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Drug addiction defined as the use of cannabis, opioids or other drugs.
- Use of medical cannabis.
- Previous neurologic, musculoskeletal (besides osteoporosis) or mental illnesses
- Lack of ability to cooperate.
- Osteoporosis grade higher than moderate or severe (T-score < -3.5)
